basIpForward.name: basIpForward
basIpForward.contactinfo: Tech Support Broadband Access Systems 201 Forest Street Marlboro, MA 01752 U.S.A. 508-485-8200 support@basystems.com
basIpForward.description: This module defines the MIB objects for a Broadband Access System IP Forwarding component.

basCidrTable.name: basCidrTable
basCidrTable.description: A list of Route Server forwarding table distribution mechanism statistics.

basIpCidrRouteNumber.name: basIpCidrRouteNumber
basIpCidrRouteNumber.description: The number of current ipCidrRouteTable entries that are not invalid.

basCidrChassis.name: basCidrChassis
basCidrChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basCidrSlot.name: basCidrSlot
basCidrSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basCidrIf.name: basCidrIf
basCidrIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basCidrLPort.name: basCidrLPort
basCidrLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.

basIpCidrRouteEntry.name: basIpCidrRouteEntry
basIpCidrRouteEntry.description: A particular route to a particular destina- tion, under a particular policy.

basIpCidrRouteDest.name: basIpCidrRouteDest
basIpCidrRouteDest.description: The destination IP address of this route. This object may not take a Multicast (Class D) address value. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bitwise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the ipCidrRouteMask object is not equal to x.

basIpCidrRouteMask.name: basIpCidrRouteMask
basIpCidrRouteMask.description: Indicate the mask to be logical-ANDed with the destination address before being compared to the value in the ipCidrRouteDest field. For those systems that do not support arbitrary subnet masks, an agent constructs the value of the ipCidrRouteMask by reference to the IP Ad- dress Class. Any assignment (implicit or otherwise) of an instance of this object to a value x must be rejected if the bitwise logical-AND of x with the value of the corresponding instance of the ipCidrRouteDest object is not equal to ipCidrRoute- Dest.

basIpCidrRouteTos.name: basIpCidrRouteTos
basIpCidrRouteTos.description: The policy specifier is the IP TOS Field. The encoding of IP TOS is as specified by the following convention. Zero indicates the default path if no more specific policy applies. +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+ | | | | | PRECEDENCE | TYPE OF SERVICE | 0 | | | | | +-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+-----+ IP TOS IP TOS Field Policy Field Policy Contents Code Contents Code 0 0 0 0 ==> 0 0 0 0 1 ==> 2 0 0 1 0 ==> 4 0 0 1 1 ==> 6 0 1 0 0 ==> 8 0 1 0 1 ==> 10 0 1 1 0 ==> 12 0 1 1 1 ==> 14 1 0 0 0 ==> 16 1 0 0 1 ==> 18 1 0 1 0 ==> 20 1 0 1 1 ==> 22 1 1 0 0 ==> 24 1 1 0 1 ==> 26 1 1 1 0 ==> 28 1 1 1 1 ==> 30

basIpCidrRouteNextHop.name: basIpCidrRouteNextHop
basIpCidrRouteNextHop.description: On remote routes, the address of the next sys- tem en route; Otherwise, 0.0.0.0.

basIpCidrRouteIfIndex.name: basIpCidrRouteIfIndex
basIpCidrRouteIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value which identifies the local interface through which the next hop of this route should be reached.

basIpCidrRouteType.name: basIpCidrRouteType
basIpCidrRouteType.description: The type of route. Note that local(3) refers to a route for which the next hop is the final destination; remote(4) refers to a route for which the next hop is not the final destina- tion. Routes which do not result in traffic forwarding or rejection should not be displayed even if the implementation keeps them stored internally. reject (2) refers to a route which, if matched, discards the message as unreachable. This is used in some protocols as a means of correctly aggregating routes.

basIpCidrRouteProto.name: basIpCidrRouteProto
basIpCidrRouteProto.description: The routing mechanism via which this route was learned. Inclusion of values for gateway rout- ing protocols is not intended to imply that hosts should support those protocols.

basIpCidrRouteAge.name: basIpCidrRouteAge
basIpCidrRouteAge.description: The number of seconds since this route was last updated or otherwise determined to be correct. Note that no semantics of `too old' can be implied except through knowledge of the routing protocol by which the route was learned.

basIpCidrRouteInfo.name: basIpCidrRouteInfo
basIpCidrRouteInfo.description: A reference to MIB definitions specific to the particular routing protocol which is responsi- ble for this route, as determined by the value specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. If this information is not present, its value should be set to the OBJECT IDENTIFIER { 0 0 }, which is a syntactically valid object identif- ier, and any implementation conforming to ASN.1 and the Basic Encoding Rules must be able to generate and recognize this value.

basIpCidrRouteNextHopAS.name: basIpCidrRouteNextHopAS
basIpCidrRouteNextHopAS.description: The Autonomous System Number of the Next Hop. The semantics of this object are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. When this object is unknown or not relevant its value should be set to zero.

basIpCidrRouteMetric1.name: basIpCidrRouteMetric1
basIpCidrRouteMetric1.description: The primary routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

basIpCidrRouteMetric2.name: basIpCidrRouteMetric2
basIpCidrRouteMetric2.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

basIpCidrRouteMetric3.name: basIpCidrRouteMetric3
basIpCidrRouteMetric3.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

basIpCidrRouteMetric4.name: basIpCidrRouteMetric4
basIpCidrRouteMetric4.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

basIpCidrRouteMetric5.name: basIpCidrRouteMetric5
basIpCidrRouteMetric5.description: An alternate routing metric for this route. The semantics of this metric are determined by the routing-protocol specified in the route's ipCidrRouteProto value. If this metric is not used, its value should be set to -1.

basIpCidrRouteStatus.name: basIpCidrRouteStatus
basIpCidrRouteStatus.description: The row status variable, used according to row installation and removal conventions.

basIpCidrRouteChassis.name: basIpCidrRouteChassis
basIpCidrRouteChassis.description: The BAS Chassis ID of the Route Server.

basIpCidrRouteSlot.name: basIpCidrRouteSlot
basIpCidrRouteSlot.description: The BAS Slot ID of the Route Server.

basIpCidrRouteIf.name: basIpCidrRouteIf
basIpCidrRouteIf.description: The BAS interface ID of the Route Server.

basIpCidrRouteLPort.name: basIpCidrRouteLPort
basIpCidrRouteLPort.description: The BAS logical port ID of the Route Server.
